lines.text: [posing as Charles Mason, Captain Clark escapes an attempt on his life]
Mr. Mason, I just wanted you to tell you how glad I am that you're safe.
lines.character: Countess Elsa von Merck, alias Trina Dressard

lines.text: Why, thank you, Ms. Dessard. I feel pretty good about it myself.
You know, I'm disappointed, I am. I've been expecting fireworks ever since Captain Clark buried his brother.
Maybe you ain't lookin' in the right direction.
Why? What are you getting at, Bill?
Have you seen Cathy around lately? Where's Idaho and Captain Clark?
Golden Eagle! Why, who are they after?
I wish I knew, Dan, I sure do. But I'm certain of one thing, you were mentionin' fireworks... Well, they're lightin' the fuse!
Oh, Miss Dessard... where did you meet Captain Randolph?
Here, just before you came. He does his own introducing and I do mine.
lines.character: Countess Elsa von Merck, alias Trina Dressard

lines.text: [reading a newspaper clipping found in the luggage of a dead spy]
This may be a lead at that!
When there's only one trail, that's the one to follow.
